H0.text: Chloroplast is the structure that a student will find only in the plant cell when comparing a plant cell to an animal cell.

H1.text: The nucleus is the structure the student will find only in the plant cell when comparing a plant cell to an animal cell.

H2.text: Mitochondrion is the structure that a student comparing a plant cell to an animal cell will find only in the plant cell.

H3.text: Cytoplasm is the structure that a student will find only in the plant cell when comparing a plant cell to an animal cell.

A4.text: Plant cells contain plastids, the most notable being chloroplasts, which contain the green-colored pigment chlorophyll that converts the energy of sunlight into chemical energy.
